Name: Airbus SE
details.KeyFacts: The Department of State ("Department") charges Airbus SE, including its operating divisions, subsidiaries, and business units ("Respondent" or "Airbus") with violations of the Arms Export Control Act ("AECA"), 22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq. and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations ("ITAR") (22 C.F.R. parts 120130) in connection with providing false statements on authorization requests; the failure to provide accurate and complete reporting on political contributions, commissions, or fees that it paid, or offered or agreed to pay, in connection with sales; the failure to maintain records involving IT AR-controlled transactions; and unauthorized reexports and retransfers of defense articles. A total of 75 violations are alleged at this time.
ViolationBreakdown: Part 130 obligations, false statements and reporting (33)
Failure to maintain Part 130 Records (36)
Unauthorized Reexports of Defense Articles (3)
Unauthorized Retransfers of Defense Articles in Spain (2)
details.OtherRequirementsTimeframe: within 30 days of the date of the Order
details.AuditDetails:
Within ten (10) months after the date of the Order, Respondent shall submit a draft audit plan for the first audit to the Director, DTCC for review and approval. Within fifteen (15) months after the date of the Order, the audit shall be completed and a written report produced containing recommendations for improvements with respect to Consent Agreement measures, or compliance with the AECA and the ITAR. Subject to applicable law and regulations, Respondent shall submit the report to the Director, DTCC along with Respondent's plan on how it shall address those recommendations.
Subsequently, Respondent shall select an outside consultant with expertise in AECA/IT AR matters, approved by the Director, DTCC to perform the second audit to confirm whether Respondent addressed the compliance recommendations from the initial audit report. The second audit shall be conducted under the supervision of the Designated Official. Within thirty (30) months after the date of the Order, Respondent shall submit a draft audit plan for the second audit to the Director, DTCC for review and comment. Within thirty-two (32) months after the date of the Order, the second audit shall be completed and a written report prepared confirming whether Respondent addressed the compliance recommendations from the initial audit report, and making additional recommendations where there were deficiencies. Subject to applicable law and regulations, Respondent shall submit the report and its plan on how it intends to address those recommendations to the Director, DTCC.
AuditDue: first audit plan due within 10 months
first audit must be completed within 15 months
second audit must be performed by outside consultant
second audit plan due within 30 months
second audit must be completed within 32 months
details.SuspensionConditions: Suspended amount to be used for remedial compliance measures
details.OSRStipulator: Any time during the duration of the Consent Agreement with "minimum advance notice"
CertDetails: all aspects of the Consent Agreement have been met
export compliance program has been assessed
export compliance program is adequate to identify, prevent, detect, correct and report violations of AECA and ITAR

Name: AeroVironment, Inc.
details.KeyFacts: The Department of State (“Department”) proposes to charge AeroVironment, Inc., including its operating divisions, subsidiaries, and business units “(Respondent”) with violations of the Arms Export Control Act (AECA), 22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq., and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), 22 CFR parts 120-130, in connection with the unauthorized export of defense articles, to include technical data; failure to properly maintain records involving ITARcontrolled transactions; and violations of the provisos, terms, and conditions of export authorizations. A total of 10 violations are alleged at this time.
ViolationBreakdown: Unauthorized export of Defense Articles to Canada (6)
Unauthorized export of technical data to Australia, France, Canada, and Thailand (1)
Unauthorized export of Shrike unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) to the United Kingdom (1)
Violation of terms and conditions of authorizations on multiple occasions (1)
Failure to maintain records of temporary or permanent exports of technical data (1)
details.OtherRequirementsTimeframe: within 30 days of the date of the Order
details.AuditDetails: Within six (6) months after the date of the Order, Respondent shall submit a draft audit plan for the audit to the Director, DTCC for review and approval. Within twelve (12) months after the date of the Order, the audit shall be completed and a written report produced containing recommendations for improvements with respect to Consent Agreement measures, or compliance with the AECA and the ITAR. Respondent shall submit the report to the Director, DTCC along with Respondent's plan on how it shall address those recommendations.
AuditDue: Audit plan due within six months
audit must be completed and written report submitted within 12 months

Name: L3Harris Technologies, Inc.
details.KeyFacts: The Department of State (“Department”) proposes to charge L3Harris Technologies, Inc. for activities conducted by Harris Corporation (“Harris”) prior to its recent merger, including its operating divisions, subsidiaries, and business units (“Respondent” or “L3Harris”) with violations of the Arms Export Control Act (AECA) (22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq.) and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) (22 CFR parts 120-130), in connection with unauthorized exports of defense articles; and violations of the terms and conditions of agreements and licenses.  A total of one hundred thirty-one (131) violations are alleged at this time.
ViolationBreakdown: Unauthoized Exports of Technical Data in the form of Software (44)
Unauthorized Exports of Tactical Radios (46)
Unauthorized Exports of defense articles (including military electronics and associated technical data, deemed SME) (17)
Unauthorized Export of technical data (1)
Failure to furnish information regarding a commission (1)
Violations of the terms of an authorization (2)
Failure to properly file information on active TAAs and MLAs (19)
Failure to present exports to CBP for endorsement
details.OtherRequirementsTimeframe: within 30 days of the date of the Order
details.AuditDetails:
Within six (6) months after the date of the Order, Respondent shall submit a draft audit plan for the first audit to the Director, DTCC for review and approval. Within twelve (12) months after the date of the Order, the audit shall be completed and a written report produced containing recommendations for improvements with respect to Consent Agreement measures, or compliance with the AECA and the ITAR. Subject to applicable law and regulations, Respondent shall submit the report to the Director, DTCC along with Respondent's plan on how it shall address those recommendations.
Subsequently, Respondent shall select an outside consultant with expertise in AECA/IT AR matters, approved by the Director, DTCC to perform the second audit to confirm whether Respondent addressed the compliance recommendations from the initial audit report. The second audit shall be conducted under the supervision of the Designated Official. Within twenty-six (26) months after the date of the Order, Respondent shall submit a draft audit plan for the second audit to the Director, DTCC for review and comment. Within thirty-two (32) months after the date of the Order, the second audit shall be completed and a written report prepared confirming whether Respondent addressed the compliance recommendations from the initial audit report, and making additional recommendations where there were deficiencies. Subject to applicable law and regulations, Respondent shall submit the report and its plan on how it intends to address those recommendations to the Director, DTCC.
AuditDue: first audit plan due within 6 months
first audit must be completed within 12 months
second audit must be performed by outside consultant
second audit plan due within 26 months
second audit must be completed within 32 months

Name: Darling Industries, Inc.
details.KeyFacts: The Department of State (“Department”) proposes to charge Darling Industries, Inc., including its operating divisions, subsidiaries, and business units “(Respondent”) with violations of the Arms Export Control Act (AECA), 22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq., and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), 22 CFR parts 120-130, in connection with unauthorized exports of defense articles; the unauthorized furnishing of defense services; and failure to appoint qualified Empowered Official. A total of six (6) violations are alleged at this time.
ViolationBreakdown: Lack of appropriate empowered official (1)
Unauthorized Export of Defense Articles and Furnishing of Defense Services (3)
Unauthorized export of defense article (2)
details.AuditDetails:
Within two (2) months after the execution of this Consent Agreement, Respondent must submit a draft plan for the audit to the Director, DTCC, for review and approval. Within four (4) months after DTCC approves the plan, the audit shall be completed and a written report submitted to the Director, DTCC.
The written report must provide the findings of the audit, recommendations where there were deficiencies, and plans to remediate the deficiencies. Respondent's written report shall also include a matrix of the findings, proposed actions, (including implementation plans and testing plans), and expected date of completion. Within six (6) months of issuing the report, no later than twelve (12) months, Respondent will submit a written report to the Director, DTCC confirming whether Respondent addressed the findings described in the written report and status of proposed actions. Respondent shall submit the report to the Director, DTCC along with Respondent's plan on how it will address any outstanding proposed actions.
AuditDue: plan due within 2 months, audit due between 6 and 12 months of order
details.PreCASuspendedTerms: Suspended amount applicable to pre or post consent agreement spending
details.SuspensionConditions: Suspended amount to be used for remedial compliance measures
details.PenaltyRelatedReportsDetails: within 6 months of the order for pre-consent agreement spend | within 12 months and annually thereafter with respect to post-consent agreement spend
details.OSRStipulator: Any time during the duration of the Consent Agreement with "minimum advance notice"
CertDetails: all aspects of the Consent Agreement have been met
export compliance program has been assessed via outside audit
export compliance program is adequate to identify, prevent, detect, correct and report violations of AECA and ITAR

Name: FLIR Systems, Inc.
details.KeyFacts: The Department of State ("Department") charges FLIR Systems, Inc. ("Respondent" or "FLIR") with violations of the Arms Export Control Act (AECA), 22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq., and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), 22 CFR Parts 120-130, in connection with the unauthorized export of defense articles; the unauthorized provision of defense services to various countries, including proscribed destinations; violations of the provisos, terms, and conditions of licenses; and failure to provide accurate and complete reporting on political contributions, commissions, and fees in connection with commercial sales of defense articles or defense services. A total of 347 violations are alleged at this time.
ViolationBreakdown: DNTCN Violations (219)
Export Authorization Violations (107)
Part 130 Violations (21)
details.AuditDetails:
Within six (6) months after the date of the Order, a draft audit plan for the first audit shall b submitted to the Director, DTCC for review and approval. Within twelve (12) months after the date of the Order, the first audit shall be completed and a written report produced containing recommendations for improvements with respect to Consent Agreement measures, or compliance with the AECA and the ITAR more generally. The report shall be submitted by Respondent to the Director, DTCC along with Respondent's plan on how it shall address those recommendations.
Subsequently, Respondent shall select an outside consultant with expertise in AECA/IT AR matters, approved by the Director, DTCC to perform the second audit to confirm whether Respondent addressed the compliance recommendations from the initial audit report. The second audit shall be conducted under the supervision of the Designated Official. Within thirty (30) months after the date of the Order, a draft audit plan for the second audit shall be completed, and a written report produced confirming whether Respondent addressed the compliance recommendations from there were defiencies. The report shall be submitted by Respondent to the Director, DTCC along with Respondent's plan on how it shall address those recommendations.
AuditDue: Audit 1: plan due within 6 months of the order, report due within 12 months of the Order
Audit 2: plan due within 30 months after the date of the Order
report due within 36 months of the Order
